FuncDef: The reset pim ipv6 control-message counters command deletes statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages.
CLIs: reset pim ipv6 control-message counters [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } ]
reset pim ipv6 { vpn-instance <instance-name> | all-instance } control-message counters [ interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages on a specified interface type.
-

Deletes statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages on a specified interface number.
-

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset pim ipv6 control-message counters interface GigabitEthernet 1/0/0
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To re-collect statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages, run the reset pim ipv6 control-message counters command to delete existing statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages.
Configuration Impact
Deleted statistics about IPv6 PIM control messages cannot be restored, but the deletion does not affect PIM running.
